reviews.sentence: I booked the hotel thinking it was actually in a different location because I was not familiar with the area but as soon as I realized I was in the wrong area I talked with the front desk clerk and he checked me out with a refund. Their professionalism was outstanding.

Close to everything. The hotel is located in Covington KY just across the river from Cincinnati making it convenient to see all the sights. While it is at the end of hotel row it is an easy walk to downtown. The neighborhood is old but we felt safe walking around even at night. The room was large and had a view of the river. The comp breakfast was terrific with lots of options. Only issue the location of the waffle maker led to a crowded corner. It might be helpful to move it to the center island. Fresh fruit yogurt basked goods variety of cereals plus eggs bacon sausage etc was plentiful. Options changed daily which was a treat. Pool was clean. Fitness center was small but satisfied my needs. Nice touch hot beverages were available 24 hours a day. Nice staff.

Convenient Location. Came into town for a concert. The hotel is located on the corner and close to the interstate so it was somewhat noisy. The staff that checked us in were friendly and helpful. Our beds were comfortable but the paint on our walls needed touched up. For the price of the hotel and the location of the hotel I think I will shop around a little more the next time I am in town. I liked the spaciousness of the bathroom and the fact that it had a refrig and microwave. It is a taxi ride to both stadiums the aquarium is close by and great eating and clubbing is nearby. It just needs some refurbishing.
Good hotel bad location. Breakfast was good room was ok. Hotel was ok but Location was bad among a couple of beer and wine stores.

Stayed for 1 night. Stayed because I had a run in Cincinnati in the early AM. Hotel staff could not really give us any details of what was in a 20 mile radius to have for dinner. The area was not very safe looking but the hotel was nice and clean. We took the extra 5 minutes and went to downtown cincinnati to have dinner and drinks much safer.

Worst Hampton Stay Ever. We are Hilton Honor members and always stay in a Hilton Family hotel because of the curtious service comfortable clean rooms and delicious complimentary breakfast. Boy was this place a huge let down. Upon check in it was rush rush rush even though nobody was waiting. The clerk went over everything in a fast monotone. She never mentioned anything about parking and entrances but we figured that out pretty easily. We came to Covington to go the Newport on the Levee and take a ghost tour. We stopped by the front desk to ask about transportation to Newport. Yet another front desk staff member looked at us like we were nuts and said. yeah there is a shuttle stop down the block in front of White Castle gave us a map. We walked to indicated shuttle stop and 2 shuttles passed us by in 20 minutes pick up every 15 mins. Finally a 3rd shuttle stopped and picked us up and stated the pick up was on the other side of the street even though there was a shuttle stop sign where we were standingUpon returned we tried to purchase snacks at the only snack vending machine on property. It took the dollar bill and showed 10 on the machine. We made our selection and it sent the dollar back out. Frustrated we returned to our room called the front desk to ask about any other snack vending. We were told the machine only takes quarters if you need change we can give it to you. a sign on the machine would have been niceAh. that nice Hampton Inn breakfast was just another let down. Very crowded. One of the employees nearly ran me over on 3 separate occasions but she did say sorry honey. They offered make it yourself waffles that was very popular because the sausage links gravy and scrambled eggs were absolutely horrible in taste. We have never thrown away a plate of food before now. They were often out of coffee creamer etc. It will now be necessary to go out for breakfast. Our room was clean but the public areas of the hotel were filthy. There was a big wad of chewing gum on the elevator entrance that was there during the 18 hours we were there. The carpet was dirty in the hallway in the lobby area and all the way down the hallway of our floor. While the rate was only 150 on a Cincinnati Red game night not the reason we were here but frankly we feel robbed. We will never ever stay at this location again and would discourage anyone else to stay here. There are several other non Hilton Family hotels just down the road. The shuttle makes stops to Covington Newport and riverside Cincinnati. There are way better options if we had only known. Super FAIL Hampton Inn.

This is an exceptional hotel. The hotel staff was amazing älways willing to help. The room were very clean. location close to everything. The staff even told us about a trolley and where to ride it. Excellent hotel. Will be stashing again soon.

welcoming staff reasonable price. Recently spent 3 nights here. Very convenient to cincinnati trolley runs every 15 minutes. Not in a particularly nice location many businesses nearby but ok felt safe. Ample breakfast included. Staff is friendly and helpful. Room was clean and a decent size. Basic hotel but then again one of the better ones I have stayed in for the price.

Location is not the best room was nice but hard to get a nights sleep due to noise. Location was nested between liquor stores which made a good night sleep hard to come by. On the first day breakfast consisted of 2 types of egg whites some regular eggs would have been nice.

Good Hotel Not ideal for getting to Cincy Childrens Hospital. I am not familiar with Cincinnati area. Needed a place to shower and lay my head while child was at Childrens Hospital. The hotel itself is great. Served is purpose. I did not check out any amenities did not care about a view good thing bc I did not have anything exciting to look at. Bed was perfect room clean and spacious. Things outside of BW control are my reason for an overall low review. The liquor store and smoke store only feet from the BW their patrons made me nervous. I71 was closed for construction during the time of my stay. There are other bridges to cross to get in to Cincinnati however my biggest complaint is geared at the city of Covington there are no street signs at intersections. So when given directions such as turn right on 4th street finding 4th Street is a crapshoot. Google Maps GPS was worthless in this area. If under stress due to personal circumstances a child at Childrens Hospital I analysis would not recommend this BW location.

Good hotel to stay at. Very clean and friendly. Price was a little high but it is high in the whole area. A Little traffic noise in the area but hotel seems pretty well shielded. Good place to stop during a trip. Had some internet problems but did nt bother to call for assistance. so ca nt really holx it against them. Good spot to get to downtown cincy without having to BE on down town Cincy.
Exceptional. Shuttle to reds game and friendliness of staff.

This place offers a great deal for the quality of stay. The lobby and rooms are clean. The staff is professional. The breakfast was delicious. Also they had a complimentary small supper of baked potatoes with toppings with two free drinks including beer. Not sure if that is a normal thing but it sure was a treat. The location is very accessible to downtown Cincinnati as well. I highly recommend Best Western in Covington.

Not what I was expecting. After reading reviews we decided on this hotel. I booked the river view. The lobby area very nice and updated as well as serving area for breakfast. Great breakfast but it stopped there. At first glance our room was great. But the bathroom had long hairs all over the floor as well as something that looked like coffee grounds under the sink area was very dusty. the toilet needed cleaned and the matt on the desk had something slopped on it that may have been more coffee grounds. The river view included the parking lot a river wall and tres I barely could see the water but the bridge and seeing Cincinnati buildings were okay during the day. Housekeeping was to re clean the room and the manager reduced our bill however the amount that was to be taken off the total does not match my calculations and she did not want to speak about it upon departure. The shuttle does not come to this hotel so it was quite a walk to get to the appropriate stop. Location was great if going to Cincinnati. The bed was very comfortable. Large room and bathroom but needs updated. Breakfast was Great. Staff was very courteous and friendly.

God location and good value for money. Hotel is just over the river from downtown Cincinnati a short Uber ride to the brewery district and downtown. Hotel has all you need for a short stay is clean has friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast included.

It was ok at best. Location to downtown restaurants. Room was n’t cleaned 1st night. And party noise from room next door AWFUL til 3 am. Was told It was bad night before then security should of been aware and ready.

Like Nice rooms. Conveniently located just over the bridge to Cincinnati. Walking distance to fine dining in Covington. Small buffet breakfast included. Dislike A bit pricy particularly when sporting events are in town.

Kind staff great location would stay again. The staff was very friendly to us and kind to our infant son. Everything was crystal clean and we appreciated the hot breakfast. The double queen rooms are a little cramped but not too bad. For those eating the hot breakfast everything was delicious except the scrambled eggs. No thanks on those.
Good location better rates.
Exceptional. Great location incredible breakfast comfortable bed.
